citrixPerformance.name: citrixPerformance

revisions.description: The initial revision of this MIB module.

citrixPerformance.contactinfo: Garth Williams 11135-23A Ave Edmonton, AB T6J4W5 Canada Tel: +1 780 434 4113 E-mail: garth.williams@wtcs.org
citrixPerformance.description: The MIB module for informant Citrix performance entities.

ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserTable.name: ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserTable
ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserTable.description: A table containing performance information for instances of 'Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt User' objects.

ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserEntry.name: ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserEntry
ctxCPUUtilizationMgmtUserEntry.description: Performance information for one particular instance of 'Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt User' object.

ctxcumuCPUEntitlement.name: ctxcumuCPUEntitlement
ctxcumuCPUEntitlement.description: CPU Entitlement is the percentage CPU resource Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt makes available to a user at a given time. When the CPU resource is fully utilized, Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt uses the share/reservation assignment and recent CPU consumption of each contending user to determine the CPU entitlement of that user. On multi-processor machines the maximum value of the counter is 100% times the number of logical processors.

ctxcumuCPUReservation.name: ctxcumuCPUReservation
ctxcumuCPUReservation.description: CPU Reservation is a percentage of the total machine CPU resource reserved for a user, should that user require it. A value in the range 1-99 indicates that a CPU reservation is applied. Zero indicates that no CPU reservation is being used. When the CPU resource is fully utilized, Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt uses the reservation when calculating the CPU entitlement of a user.

ctxcumuCPUShares.name: ctxcumuCPUShares
ctxcumuCPUShares.description: CPU Shares represents the proportion of CPU resource assigned to a user. The value is an integer in the range 1-64. Zero indicates that no CPU shares value is being used. When the CPU resource is fully utilized, Citrix CPU Utilization Mgmt uses the shares value when calculating the CPU entitlement of a user.

ctxcumuCPUUsage.name: ctxcumuCPUUsage
ctxcumuCPUUsage.description: CPU Usage is the percentage of CPU resource consumed by a user at a given time, averaged over a few seconds. Used to identify significant consumers of CPU resource and to provide CPU usage accounting data. On multi-processor machines the maximum value of the counter is 100% times the number of logical processors.

ctxcumuLongTermCPUUsage.name: ctxcumuLongTermCPUUsage
ctxcumuLongTermCPUUsage.description: Long-term CPU Usage is the percentage of CPU resource consumed by a user, averaged over a longer period than the CPU Usage counter. On multi-processor machines the maximum value of the counter is 100% times the number of logical processors.

ctxSecureTicketAuthority.name: ctxSecureTicketAuthority
ctxSecureTicketAuthority.description: The Secure Ticket Authority Service object includes those counters that apply to the Secure Ticket Authority service.

ctxstaSTABadDataRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTABadDataRequestCount
ctxstaSTABadDataRequestCount.description: The total number of unsuccessful ticket validation and data retrieval requests during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTABadRefreshRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTABadRefreshRequestCount
ctxstaSTABadRefreshRequestCount.description: The total number of unsuccessful ticket refresh requests received during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTABadTicketRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTABadTicketRequestCount
ctxstaSTABadTicketRequestCount.description: The total number of unsuccessful ticket generation requests received during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTACountOfActiveTickets.name: ctxstaSTACountOfActiveTickets
ctxstaSTACountOfActiveTickets.description: Total count of active tickets currently held in the STA.

ctxstaSTAGoodDataRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTAGoodDataRequestCount
ctxstaSTAGoodDataRequestCount.description: The total number of successful ticket validation and data retrieval requests received during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTAGoodRefreshRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTAGoodRefreshRequestCount
ctxstaSTAGoodRefreshRequestCount.description: The total number of successful ticket refresh requests received during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTAGoodTicketRequestCount.name: ctxstaSTAGoodTicketRequestCount
ctxstaSTAGoodTicketRequestCount.description: The total number of successful ticket generation requests received during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTAPeakAllRequestRate.name: ctxstaSTAPeakAllRequestRate
ctxstaSTAPeakAllRequestRate.description: The maximum rate of all monitored activities per second.

ctxstaSTAPeakDataRequestRate.name: ctxstaSTAPeakDataRequestRate
ctxstaSTAPeakDataRequestRate.description: The maximum rate of data requests per second during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRefreshRate.name: ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRefreshRate
ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRefreshRate.description: The maximum rate of refresh requests per second during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRequestRate.name: ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRequestRate
ctxstaSTAPeakTicketRequestRate.description: The maximum rate of ticket generation requests per second during the lifetime of the STA.

ctxstaSTATicketTimeoutCount.name: ctxstaSTATicketTimeoutCount
ctxstaSTATicketTimeoutCount.description: The total number of ticket timeouts that occurred during the lifetime of the STA.
